title: CosmOS v8.1.1 ReturnOfNight (Nov 2013 Win 8.1 Mod)
description:
Just starting off the CosmOS v8.1.1 mod (Windows 8.1), it's far from perfect/complete, but done enough to speed people up installing 8.1 to their PC's

I decided to update my builder to support Windows 8.1 yesterday and today, this is the produced OS it generated (so not long spent working on it).

I removed nVidia, AMD, Intel drivers and AVG etc from ssWPI as they were quite large and readily available from LastOS: <a href="
http://www.lastos.org/team/AppReposi...ate&order=desc" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://www.lastos.org/team/AppReposi...ate&order=desc</a>

You just put them into the ISO, in ssAppsInstalls or ppAppsInstalls. You will have to delete the "ssWPI_App_DB.ini" from the folders you update or it will not show the new apps in ssWPI, you can right click the list in ssWPI and pick Re-Scan for items to create new DB files (if using it from USB or an extracted folder prior to adding it back to an ISO).

This is self activating with KMSpico 9.3 and fully automated until the end of the install where you must reboot manually to enable UAC again.

You can switch the default account "User" (Home User) to your Outlook/Hotmail account without losing any of the tweaks/app installs. I've included a "Change To Online Account.jpg" to the root of the ISO that shows how to do this.

I set auto update to notify you but not download automatically, this is easily changed from the settings.

Included in ssWPI is Classic Shell for if you really hate the Metro/Modern Interface.

The default password for "User" is "password", this was required as an empty password is not allowed at the log on stage of setup.

This is the first Windows 8+ mod I have done, so I don't expect it to be perfect and as I've only spent a short time on it (I don't get a lot of time to spare lately) it's not as complete as it could be.

The templat
